title: [SOLVED]3476 new battery kills green light
message: Just had a retina going fine. Determined it needed a new battery. Put one in, and the mag safe light goes off. I suspect it's blown the mag safe? I changed MagSafes, ran the board sans battery, works fine. Plugged in battery, plugged in MagSafe, light was green for a moment, then dead. (Board stayed lit up from battery power). No apparent previous liquid damage, but did have a prior charging issue.  Any ideas? I hate 3476 boards.

title: [SOLVED]3476 new battery kills green light
message:
Seems like it is overloading the charger and shutting it down. It should reset if you unplug it from AC for a while.
Check Q7155 for short first.

title: [SOLVED]3476 new battery kills green light
message: [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER], I tried a different battery, seems to not be overloading mag safe anymore. Problem is, board works 100% fine, runs on MagSafe or battery just fine, but it's not recognizing charging. I plug it in, boot it up, it shows a charging lightning bolt but when I click on the battery it says "battery not charging". Probes around isl6259, all resistors seem to be within spec. Any idea? I'd hate to scrap this just because of the battery not charging.

title: [SOLVED]3476 new battery kills green light
message: @dukefawks: solved, I had a different q7155 in it, changed it out, problem solved. Thanks!
